description: From Middle English undercasten, equivalent to under- +â€Ž cast.

entries.meaning: (meteorology) An unbroken or nearly unbroken cloud layer below the point of observation.
examples: Undercast is common on Mount Washington.

entries.meaning: (mining) An air-passage crossing a road in a mine by means of an airtight box or channel beneath it.

verbs.description: undercast (third-person singular simple present undercasts, present participle undercasting, simple past and past participle undercast)

entries.meaning: To allocate the parts in (a play or film) to insufficiently skilled actors.
